p: Clinical diagnosis of RVF may be hindered because of the similar presentation to other endemic mosquito-borne illnesses, such as malaria or dengue [ 11, 16]. Diagnosis of RVF is made by virus isolation or polymerase chain reaction (PCR) in the early stage of clinical disease [ 17]. Virus neutralisation assays are the gold standard of antibody detection, but the requirement for live virus makes their use limited [ 18]. Enzyme-linked immunosorbent assays (ELISA) for Immunoglobulin M and IgG can be used for diagnosis and surveillance of RVF, identifying recent and historic exposure, respectively [ 19].
